item.title: How do you make the program choose a random String?
item.dc:creator: @Coldmedicine Coldmedicine
item.description:
@Coldmedicine wrote:

Well then you add a math method, not sure if it works tough

if (itemId == 2520) { //toy horsey if(System.currentTimeMillis() - c.buryDelay > 1500) { final int random = MathUtils.random(3); switch (random) { case 0: return "Come on Dobbin, we can win the race!"; case 1: return "Neaahhhyyy!"; case 2: return "Giddy-up horsey!"; default: return "Hi-ho Silver, and away!"; c.forcedChatUpdateRequired = true; c.updateRequired = true; c.startAnimation(921); c.sendMessage("You play with the toy horsey."); c.buryDelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); } }

item.title: How do you make the program choose a random String?
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Hello I am trying to implement the Toy Horsey feature into my 2006 Recreation. Now I just do not know how to make this method work with an array of strings.

public static String Horsey()
    {
    	return Horsey[(String)(Math.random()*Horsey.length)];
    }

Read full topic
